intro: Xyris scoparia, commonly known as the narrowleaf yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Xyridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Xyris scoparia is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
